ovdesc.p: This application is used by dealers to place fiduciary deposits made by customers with other banks. The placement contract is generated automatically from the FD.FID.ORDERS made by customers, the dealer must decide which bank the funds are to be placed with and the interest rate applicable.

desc.p: Defines the status of a request for reimbursement of principal by the customer of the associated FD.FID.ORDER.

Once a request for reimbursement has been received, the dealer must accept the request by changing the REIMBURSE.STATUS to ACCEPTED. On authorisation of the placement, the status is set to ACTIONED and the confirmation is generated and sent to the FID.BANK.
Once the reimbursement is actioned, the status cannot be changed.
REQUESTED, ACCEPTED or ACTIONED. (Optional input)
A status of ACTIONED cannot be changed.
No input allowed with no REIMBURSE.DATE.
The bank where the funds are to be placed.

The Fid bank will be automatically assigned when the placement is created, if the pooled group used to generate the placement contains orders of one customer only, and that customer has expressed a preferred bank (on FD.CUST.DETAILS).

A customer can express banks which the funds should not be placed with, this is defined on FD.CUST.DETAILS for information only. Each customer may also express the maximum amount to be placed with any one bank, and also individual limits for each bank for placement of funds.

Defines the status of the associated PRIN.CHANGE.

Once the account officer has submitted a request for PRINCIPAL change, the CHANGE.STATUS will be set to REQUESTED for the associated PRIN.CHANGE and CHANGE.DATE. If the dealer accepts the change request, they must do so by setting the CHANGE.STATUS to ACCEPTED. If the dealer does not wish to accept the change, the change fields must be removed from the FD.FID.ORDER record.

Once the dealer has Accepted the change and authorised the contract, it cannot be removed. Changes accepted in error can effectively be reversed by adding a change for the opposite amount to the FD.FID.ORDER record for the same CHANGE.DATE, which must also be ACCEPTED by the dealer.
There will only ever be 1 REQUESTED change for the same CHANGE.DATE.

This field indicates the method that will be followed if the cycled interest settlement date is a non working day in the relative currency.
The following provides an explanation of the various input values for this field:
Null = Calendar The sysem will use the same date irrespective of whether dates cycled are working days or not.
1 = Forward The system will cycle forward to the next available working day.
2 = Backward The system will cycle to the previous working day.
3 = Fwd Same Month The system will cycle forward unless the next working day unless it falls in the next month. In this case, it will cycle to the previous working day.

Specifies for NOTICE placements, whether the placement is to have the interest rates and payment dates determined by the FD.GROUP.PAYMENT mechanism, or whether the contract is to be maintained manually.

Most NOTICE placements are grouped by currency, fiduciary bank and days notice, and interest rates and payment dates are quoted by the Fiduciary bank for these groups. In certain cases one placement may require a special set of rate conditions, in which case it will be processed in isolation from the group. Input of Y in this field specifies that this placement is not to be included in the FD.GROUP.PAYMENT record applicable to the placement, and interest rate and payment date must be entered on the contract.
Input of NO denotes that the interest rate and payment dates are to be extracted from the FD.GROUP.PAYMENT record which applies to the placement. The key to the FD.GROUP.PAYMENT file is comprised of:
Fid Bank "." Currency "." Days Notice

Any difference amount between the interest due on the placement, and the interest to be paid to the associated orders.

In some case the full INTEREST.AMT is not equal to the sum of the ORDER.INT. In these cases the difference will be calculated and stored in this field. At interest payment the difference amount will be posted to a difference account. The difference account posted to is defined on the FD.PARAMETER. The category in the field INT.DIFF.CAT is combined with the placement currency to form an internal account number.
An example of a difference entry is described below:

FIXED Placement for 300,000 USD Interest Amount of 1,000 USD The placement is comprised of 3 orders, each for 100,000 USD The interest due to each order is therefore 1,000 * 100,000 / 300,000 = 333.33 USD The total interest for the 3 orders is 999.99 USD, leaving a difference entry of 0.01 USD.

Specifies the value date when the associated PRIN.CHANGEs are to take place.

The customer may require a change to the existing principal of NOTICE order. This is entered by the account officer in the PRIN.CHANGE field of the order, with the corresponding CHANGE.DATE when the change is to be effective. On authorisation of the order, the placement is automatically updated with the PRIN.CHANGE and CHANGE.DATE, the associated CHNG.STATUS field is set to REQUESTED, and the associated ORDER.ID field is set to the key of the order which generated the change.

The dealer must accept the request for principal change by changing the CHNG.STATUS to ACCEPTED. Once the change is accepted, the confirmation is sent to the FID.BANK, and the status is then set to ACTIONED on the placement, and the corresponding Order. The principal change will be made during the end of day on the CHANGE.DATE requested.
Fields CHANGE.DATE to CHNG.STATUS form a related multi value set.

The limit reference of the product applicable to the placement contract.

Fiduciary placements do not represent any risk from the Bank's point of view, but the bank may still wish to assign a limit to the fiduciary bank. Limits can be assigned and checked as any other loan limit if required, by setting the LIMIT.REF to a value defined on the LIMIT.REFERENCE with FX.OR.TIME.BANDS set to 'TB'.

A Limit Reference with the FX.OR.TIME.BAND value of 'IN' can be specified, which shows that the limit is an information limit only. A credit line can be allocated for an information limit if required, and the overrides will be generated where appropriate by setting the CHECK.LIMIT flag to Y on the Limit record. If no limit record is specified for an information limit, the record is still created but with the CHECK.LIMIT flag set to NO, resulting in no Limit override messages.

If no entry is made in this field the value defined for the type on placement on the LIMIT.PARAMETER record will be defaulted. If no default is found an error message will be generated. A default serial number of '01' will always be defaulted, and the limit will be created automatically if it does not already exist. Any other serial number must form part of the key to an existing limit record.

The customer may require a change to the existing principal of NOTICE order. On authorisation of the order, the placement is automatically updated with the PRIN.CHANGE and CHANGE.DATE, the associated CHNG.STATUS field is set to REQUESTED and the associated ORDER.ID field is updated with the key to the FD.FID.ORDER record which generated the request.

The dealer must accept the request for principal change by changing the CHNG.STATUS to ACCEPTED. Once the change is accepted, the confirmation is sent to the FID.BANK, and the status is then set to ACTIONED on the placement, and the corresponding Order. The principal change will be made during the end of day on the CHANGE.DATE requested.
A negative PRIN.CHANGE denotes that a principal decrease is requested.
Fields CHANGE.DATE to CHNG.STATUS form a related multi value set. Fields ORDER.ID to CHNG.STATUS form a related sub value set.
